result.execSummary:
The defendant Susan L Snowmountain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>10,000 g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)5.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Court notes that Proabtion may be transferred to the State of California, if approved.

miscConds.notes:
Fine is set at ZERO.
Pay all mandatory Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of Probation, to the Probation agent.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Maintain full-time employment to the extent that her medical provider allows

Court advised defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and voting.  
NO possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.

* NO CONTACT with Codi K. (DOB 04-25-1982).  
* NO use or possession/ use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid presctoption, taken ia the manner & fashion as prescribed. 
* NO possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use unless with a valid prescription, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution. 
* NO possession of any drug paraphernalia for manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.  
* Defenadnt may not grow or produce THC.
* Defendant may not possess any more that 4 ounces of THC at any one time.

* Defendant to notify the DOC agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days of receiving prescription from medical professional. 
* Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by DOC agent and notify the DOC agent of the pharmacy used. 
*Mental Health evaluation and any recommended treatment Court suggests Trauma Informed Mental Health treatment. 
* Provide DNA sample if not already done.

Participate in AODA assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY

timeConds.notes:
Release for the Day Reporting Center, work, inmate work assignments & medical appointments, without Good Time credit.   Court remains silent as to Electronic Monitoring.   Report on 08-03-15 at 8:15 a.m. in Court room 310 of Safety Building.  Court reiterates defendant is under all conditions of bail and orders the defendant may not leave the State of Wisconsin during the period prior  to her report date on  08-03-15.
Court notes no objection to the Condition Time transferred to Vernon County, if accepted

Certification of SENTENCING HEARING transcript commencing JULY 27, 2015 received and filed. (68 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ATTORNEY JACOB A. MANIAN, FOX, O'NEILL & SHANNON, S.C., 622 NORTH WATER STREET, STE. 500, MILWAUKEE, WISCONSIN, 53202. kl

Defendant Susan L Snowmountain in court with attorney Robin Shellow.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 2-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.
- Court notes that probation maybe transferred to the State of California if approved. 
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days  of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use unless with a valid prescription, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant my not grow or produced THC. 
- Defendant may not possess any more that 4 ounces of THC at any one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Maintain fulltime employment to the extent that her medical provider allows. 
- No contact with Codi K. (DOB 04-25-1982).
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Court suggests Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 7 MONTHS  CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center, work, inmate work assignments, and medical appointments. Court remains silent to electronic monitoring.  REPORT on 08-03-2015 at 8:15 am, in Court room 310 of Safety Building. Court REITERATES defendant is under all conditions of bail, and orders that defendant may not leave the State of Wisconsin during the period prior to her report date on 08-03-2015. Court notes no objection to the condition time transferred to Vernon County if accepted. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail on deposit to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Letter on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk
Letter with supporting documentation on behalf of the defendant from Attorney Shellow received and filed. tk

Defendant Susan L Snowmountain in court with attorney Robin Shellow.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court ordered that any sentencing filings be filed with the Court at least 3 days prior to the sentencing hearing date.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
